Class Auction

java.lang.Object
  Auction

public class Auction
extends java.lang.Object

A simple model of an auction. The auction maintains a list of lots of arbitrary length.

Version:
2011.07.31
Author:
David J. Barnes and Michael KÃ¶lling.

Method Detail

close

public void close()
ex 4.48 - add a close method. any Lots with a bid = sold, look for highestBid of null.

enterLot

public void enterLot(java.lang.String description)
Enter a new lot into the auction.

Parameters:
description - A description of the lot.

getLot

public Lot getLot(int lotNumber)
Return the lot with the given number. Return null if a lot with this number does not exist.

Parameters:
lotNumber - The number of the lot to return.

getLot2

public Lot getLot2(int lotNumber)
ex 4.51 - rewrite of getLot so it does not rely on a lot with a particular number being stored at index (number - 1). For example, if a lot is removed, all objects above it will be moved down one spot in the ArrayList so n-1 won't work. You may assume that lots are always stored in increasing order according to their lot numbers.

getUnsold

public java.util.ArrayList<Lot> getUnsold()
ex 4.49 - unsold method to get all Lot objects with highestBid == null

makeABid

public void makeABid(int lotNumber,
                     Person bidder,
                     long value)
Make a bid for a lot. A message is printed indicating whether the bid is successful or not.

Parameters:
lotNumber - The lot being bid for.
bidder - The person bidding for the lot.
value - The value of the bid.

showLots

public void showLots()
Show the full list of lots in this auction.
